summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of AriesXHit Chrome extension landing page. All core functionality, responsiveness, and UI elements are working correctly.

design_issues.issue: Telegram channel links are placeholder URLs (https://t.me/your_main_channel and https://t.me/your_backup_channel) instead of real channels
Download URL points to '/ariesxhit-extension.zip' which may not exist on server

passed_tests: Hero section renders correctly with logo, title 'ARIESXHIT', subtitle, and version badge
Header displays two Telegram redirect buttons (Main Channel and Backup)
Download Extension buttons are clickable and trigger download functionality
How to Use button scrolls smoothly to installation guide section
Features section displays all 12 feature cards in responsive bento grid layout
Installation Guide shows all 5 steps with proper timeline design
Download section displays performance specs (4 cards) and giant download button
Footer displays contact @MikeyyFrr with proper Telegram link
Mobile responsive design works correctly across all viewport sizes (390px, 768px, 1920px)
Particles animation is visible and functioning in background
All animations, hover effects, and smooth scrolling work properly
All interactive elements have proper data-testid attributes for testing
Telegram links open in new tabs with proper target='_blank' attributes

action_item_for_main_agent.placeholder_links: Update Telegram channel URLs from placeholder values to real channel links
action_item_for_main_agent.download_file: Ensure the ariesxhit-extension.zip file exists at the download URL path or update the download functionality
